revised_title: A Detailed Account of a Prolific Rainstorm and Its Effects on Denbigh, Wales
tldr: A persistent rainstorm in Denbigh, Wales, caused widespread flooding and damage. The storm lasted 30 hours, overflowing rivers and destroying bridges, trees, and landmarks. The author attributes the severity of the floods to the breaking out of numerous springs in the area, which altered the landscape and caused significant damage to infrastructure.
